intro: Koeleria vallesiana var. abbreviata, commonly known as the short-stemmed valley grass, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the western United States. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. This variety is notable for its compact growth habit and is often found in meadows and open slopes at elevations above 6,000 feet.
